title: Social Security benefits to jump 5.9% in 2022 in biggest increase in 40 years
text:
These quality dividend stocks have a built-in advantage that can keep you ahead of inflation in 2022

Bill McMahon, chief investment officer at Charles Schwab Asset Management, favors consumer discretionary stocks that pay dividends and own beloved brands. See full story.

Will bank stocks' wild rally continue? Here are the numbers to watch in this week's earnings

Potential earnings success from Bank of America, Citi, Wells Fargo, Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase hinges on lending activity increases in the face of competition from non-banks and cautiousness from potential borrowers. See full story.

‘I quit,' a record number of U.S. workers are telling their bosses

A record number of U.S. workers quit in August, potentially signaling more trouble ahead for businesses already struggling to fill some 10 million open jobs. See full story.

The hedge funds that left wildfire victims holding the bag on PG&E stock

Billionaire David Tepper and his Appaloosa Management led a group of hedge funds netting at least $2 billion by dumping PG&E stock awarded by a bankruptcy court, according to a KQED and the California Newsroom report. See full story.

MARKETWATCH PERSONAL FINANCE

‘He has lived with me free for six months. I have paid for trips, household groceries, and 95% of dining out.' See full story.
